intro: Pedicularis longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
